div3.head: By Goddin & Apperson, Criers.
div3.p:
Commissioner's Sale of A large Brick Dwelling in Sydney, together with about three Acres of Land attached thereto, bounded by streets on four sides — As Commissioner of the Circuit Court of Henrico, by a decree pronounced on the 2d of May, 1863, in the case of Meredith against Meredith, &c, I shall proceed to sell, at public auction, on the premises, on Monday, the 22d of June, 1863, at 4½ o'clock P M, (if fair; if not, the next fair day thereafter,) the beautiful square of Land located as above, bounded by Narvie, Grove, and Plum streets, and also by the old Coal Pit road, together with the large and admirably well built Brick Dwelling thereon, being the same of which the late Dr Reuben Meredith died seized, and now in the occupancy of Mr. Peter D Barnard.
The property will be so divided as to sell with the Dwelling Lot No £6, and the remaining Lots, Nos $7 and $8, will be sold separately.
The foregoing is justly regarded as the most valuable suburban property now on the market.

Terms.--One third cash; balance at 6 and 12 months, for bonds or notes bearing interest, properly secured; or all oath, at the option of the purchaser.
The taxes and insurance for this year to be paid by the purchaser.
div3.closer: John A Meredith, Comm'r. je 11

div3.p: Trustee's Sale of very valuable Brick-yard property and other Real Estate, in Port Mayo and near thereto.--At the request of Mr Jos G Watts, I shall sell at public auction on the premises on Friday, the 19th of June, 1863, at 4½ o'clock P M, the following very valuable Real Estate, viz:

That truly valuable Brick-Yard in Port Mayo, near Rocketts, containing about five acres, with buildings and stables sufficient for an extensive manufacture of bricks.
The clay is of very superior quality, and extends to the depth of 30 to 40 feet. There are in the kiln clamps about 100,000 Bricks, to be sold after the yard is disposed of. On the lot is a fine Wheelwright and Blacksmith Shop.
Also, about three acres of Land in the plan of Mount Erin or Fox Branch, well adapted for a tanyard, as has a stream of water running through it. It is also valuable for other purposes.

Also, several Lots in Lewis's plan, near to Fulton, and some Lots in Fulton.
These lots, or some of them, are particularly valuable for foundrymen, as they contain a fine parcel of moulders' sand.
Plate and surveys of the lots will be exhibited at the time of sale.

Terms.--One-fourth cash; balance at 6, 12, and 18 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
The taxes for the present year to be paid by the purchaser.
div3.closer: John P Dickinson, Trustee. je 9

div3.head: By James M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.
div3.p:
A most Desirable residence for Sale at Auction.--On Tuesday, the 10th inst, at 5 o'clock P M, we will offer for sale at auction that excellent and desirable four-story Brick Dwelling, on the corner of Grace and 1st sts, at present occupied by Mr J B White.
The house contains eleven rooms, together with kitchen, carriage house, stable, etc, with all the modern improvements, and in good order.
Immediate possession will be given.
Terms--Made known on day of sale; taxes and insurance for 1863 to be paid by the purchaser.

div3.head: Conveyance to the Rappahannock river.
div3.p:
--I will leave John E Davis's stable, on Franklin street, with a covered Wagon, Monday Evening, at 4 o'clock, for Church View, Middlessex county.
Persons wishing to get passage can be accommodated.
Price $50.

div3.head: Two hundred dollars reward.
div3.p:
--The above reward will be paid for the arrest and delivery to me (or delivery in any jail, so that I may get them.) of my two negro boys, George and Stephen, who left my place in Halifax county, Va. on Tuesday, 2d inst. George is about twenty years of age, 5 feet 7 or 2 inches high, black, well formed, large nose, and pleasant countenance.
Stephen 5 feet 2 inches high, dark copper color, very short legs, and long bodied for his height; moves well, and is about nineteen or twenty years of age. They were purchased from and Southampton counties, and may try to make their way to those places.
One hundred dollars each will be paid for their apprehension and delivery as above stated.
div3.closer:
T Rambiston, Jr.
Box 979 Richmond P O,
Or. Wolf Trap Depot, Halifax co. je 11--5t*
